entry.title: Suggestion for a universal bitcoin value scale
entry.summary: The context discusses the use of colors in user experience (UX) design and how they have expected meanings, such as red indicating an error and green indicating a possible action. However, the use of colors can also create issues with legibility for text and accessibility for colorblind individuals. In an email to the bitcoin-dev mailing list, Martin Damgaard suggests a universal bitcoin value color scale to address the decimal problem identified in BIP 176. He acknowledges his unfamiliarity with BIP procedures but follows the example set by Jimmy Song in creating a similar proposal. The attached document is provided in three different formats.
